intro: Alsine radicans, commonly known as匍匐冰草, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate stems that root at the nodes, forming dense mats on the ground. The plant produces small, green to reddish flowers that are clustered in spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along riverbanks. Alsine radicans is adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions, making it a resilient and widespread species in its native habitats.
